channel.title: The Horror
channel.description:
In c2a2a; The second map of "ON A RAIL" the first one being an introductory one with a security guard and that scary music "Sirens in the distance" Just as the map starts a horrifying otherworldly screaming is heard ecchoing through the corridors. It is in a series of four spine chilling sounds named the_horror1, the_horror2, etc. One is heard on the aforementioned location on earth, another one is heard in the c4a1f; The level with giant red portal to the Nihilanths chamber. the_horror2 is used in Left 4 Dead when a horde starts.
What creature could make this terrible noise? Discuss.

item.title: The Horror
item.dc:creator: Scorpion42
item.description:
coldroll:

You guys have given me the idea of modding the horror now.

What do you mean? Replacing it with stupid attempts to make ghost sounds?

WooooOOOOooooh

EDIT: Did i really write that? I hopefully didn’t mean that in a bad way. That would actually be pretty funny. Maybe it could be the marines trying to scare Gordon?

Read full topic

item.title: The Horror
item.dc:creator: Ballsopt
item.description:
on a similar “spooky” note, in POINT INSERTION (hl2), you can faintly hear the ghostly echoes of children playing when you walk by the abandoned playground.

item.title: The Horror
item.dc:creator: Zerego
item.description:
Scorpion42:

They wouldn’t add The Horror for the lulz. I don’t even find it funny.

Half-Life is a serious game. If anything, it’s trying.

Valve has a weird sense of humor.

Read full topic

item.title: The Horror
item.dc:creator: Scorpion42
item.description:
Looks like my thead has freezed. We haven’t come to any conclusions.
Here’s a kickstart:
The Horror is heard at several point’s in Xen (For example from the gate to the Nihilanths lair) So i don’t see how it could be the zombie horde. Maybe it’s from the dark depths of Gordons imagination?

Come on guys, Discuss!

Read full topic

item.title: The Horror
item.dc:creator: Ibanez
item.description:
Scorpion42:

There’ve never been ambient music in the Half-Life series, not really. The closest was those wierd sounds in Ravenholm. Are you thinking about the music playing when the gar is killed?

No, I’m talking about the fucking music playing at that exact moment on the tram. I just played it, I know it’s there.

Read full topic

item.title: The Horror
item.dc:creator: Ibanez
item.description:
I just played through from the previous level, c2a2. Notice how creepy ambient music was placed right at the end of c2a2? Well, my bets are that those sound effects were placed to emphasize the music, because they go right alongside it and pretty much add to the creepiness. Too bad they’re so subtle, that’s a neat little detail I wish I’d noticed when I played when I was younger. Woulda made me shit brix for sure. :fffuuu:

Read full topic

item.title: The Horror
item.dc:creator: Grey_Acumen
item.description:
The fast zombie howl still sends waves of panic down my back. The other sounds they make do a pretty good job at keeping that panic in place. I’ve gotten better about it, and it isn’t quite as much of a gibbering panic as it used to be, but it’s still there.

Read full topic

item.title: The Horror
item.dc:creator: JohnWorfin
item.description:
Mr. Someguy:

It’s the zombie horde. Black Mesa was experimenting on a zombie virus that could be used in warfare. But then in an alternet reality (where gordon’s experiment went prefectly), the virus infected a scientist, who boarded a North-Eastern US bound plane and infected everyone on board. The plane crashed near Philidelphia and started the Infected in Left 4 Dead.

So, not only did the resonance cascade open a rift in to xen, it also distorted space-time resulting in two parallel earths where one experiences a combine invasion and the other gets a zombie invasion. DAMN YOU G-MAN!!!

Read full topic
